poem:
**The Secret in Shadows**

In the borrowed rooms   
where whispers lean softly,  
our lives unfold. Beyond walls,  
desires are displaced;  
in foreign skies of flight,   
the passion wails.  
Unseen, unclaimed,  
the love in its reluctance  
cowers. At home,   
the silence lingers,  
a secret untold  
in the light of day.
